Troubleshooting Common Copier Issues: A Simple Guide for Office Users

July 8, 2025 Marga Enterprises

When your copier suddenly stops working in the middle of printing important documents, it can bring your entire office to a halt. Troubleshooting common copier issues doesn't have to be complicated. With a basic understanding of what’s causing the problem, most copier errors can be resolved quickly—saving time, money, and frustration.

In this guide, we’ll walk you through the most frequent copier problems and their solutions, helping you prevent unnecessary downtime and keep your business operations running smoothly.

1. Paper Jams

The Problem: One of the most frequent copier complaints is the dreaded paper jam. This happens when sheets of paper get stuck in the machine.

Possible Causes:

  • Incorrect paper size or thickness

  • Overfilled paper tray

  • Dirty or worn-out rollers

  • Humid or curled paper

Troubleshooting Steps:

  • Open all access panels and gently remove the jammed paper.

  • Make sure you’re using the recommended paper type and size.

  • Clean the paper rollers with a lint-free cloth.

  • Refill the tray neatly—don’t overload.

Tip: Prevent future jams by fanning the paper before loading and storing it in a dry area.

2. Poor Print Quality

The Problem: Are your documents coming out with streaks, smudges, or faded areas? Poor print quality can make important papers look unprofessional.

Possible Causes:

  • Low or old toner

  • Dirty scanner glass or mirrors

  • Misaligned print heads

  • Drum unit issues

Troubleshooting Steps:

  • Check if the toner needs replacing or shaking.

  • Wipe down the glass surface and internal mirrors gently.

  • Run a print head alignment or calibration.

  • Inspect the drum for wear and replace if needed.

For ongoing maintenance concerns, refer to this helpful Maintenance and Support FAQ from Marga Enterprises.

3. Copier Not Powering On

The Problem: The copier won’t turn on—no lights, no screen, no sounds.

Possible Causes:

  • Unplugged or loose power cable

  • Faulty power outlet

  • Internal power supply issue

Troubleshooting Steps:

  • Check if the power cord is plugged in securely.

  • Try plugging the machine into another outlet.

  • If there’s still no power, consult a technician—there may be a hardware fault.

4. Lines or Spots on Copies

The Problem: Your scanned or copied documents have unexpected lines or spots.

Possible Causes:

  • Dirt or marks on the scanner glass

  • Faulty drum or toner cartridge

  • Debris on the document feeder

Troubleshooting Steps:

  • Clean the glass, especially the thin strip used for scanning via ADF.

  • Replace the toner or drum if the issue persists.

  • Check the document feeder path for any residue or bits of paper.

5. Slow Printing or Copying

The Problem: The copier takes forever to finish a job, even for a few pages.

Possible Causes:

  • High-resolution print settings

  • Network congestion (for network-connected printers)

  • Memory overload

Troubleshooting Steps:

  • Switch to standard resolution for everyday printing.

  • Limit large print jobs during peak office hours.

  • Clear the printer queue and restart the copier.

  • Consider upgrading your copier model if delays are frequent.

6. Error Codes on Display

The Problem: An error code appears, and you have no idea what it means.

Possible Causes:

  • Internal component failure

  • Firmware glitch

  • Low consumables (toner, drum, etc.)

Troubleshooting Steps:

  • Look up the specific error code in your copier manual or manufacturer website.

  • Power cycle the machine (turn off, wait 30 seconds, turn on).

  • If the error persists, contact your copier provider for help.

Pro Tip: Renting a copier often includes service support. Learn more in this overview of copier rental FAQs.

7. Copier Not Connecting to Network

The Problem: The copier isn’t connecting to your network, meaning you can’t print wirelessly or scan to email.

Possible Causes:

  • Wrong IP address or network settings

  • Wi-Fi signal issues

  • Driver or firmware problems

Troubleshooting Steps:

  • Verify the IP address on the copier matches your network.

  • Restart the router and copier.

  • Reinstall or update the printer drivers on your computer.

  • For business use, wired connections are often more reliable than Wi-Fi.

When to Call a Technician

While many copier problems are DIY-friendly, some require expert support—especially hardware failures, persistent error codes, or issues that keep returning.

If you're renting a copier, you're in luck. Most rental agreements include maintenance and repair services. Not sure if yours does? Learn what to look for in a copier rental agreement.

Preventing Copier Problems: Best Practices

Prevention is always better than cure. Follow these practices to keep your copier running smoothly:

  • Regular maintenance: Clean the machine weekly.

  • Use proper supplies: Only use compatible toner, paper, and parts.

  • Train staff: Show your team the right way to load paper, clear jams, and change toner.

  • Schedule inspections: Ask your copier rental provider about regular check-ups.

If you’re currently deciding whether to rent or buy, check out this guide to choosing the right copier rental to save costs and avoid headaches.

Final Thoughts

Copiers may seem complicated, but with a little knowledge, most problems can be handled without a call to support. By understanding these troubleshooting common copier issues, you can reduce downtime, improve workflow, and keep your office running smoothly.

Looking to upgrade or rent a new copier with included support? Understanding the costs involved in copier rentals can help you make a smart decision for your business.
